name: Residential Quarter
context: These household tablets were uncovered in the collapsed remains of family dwellings. Most were found in what appear to be kitchen areas and storage rooms. The tablets show a more personal, informal style compared to public or commercial texts. Many show signs of daily handling and wear from frequent use in domestic activities.

texts.name: Family Meal Planning
texts.notes: Found in kitchen hearth area. Worn script from repeated handling during meal preparation.

texts.name: Children's Task List
texts.notes: Discovered in family courtyard. Large, simple script suggesting instructions for young helpers.

texts.name: Evening Routine
texts.notes: Found near sleeping area. Gentle script worn from nightly reading - possibly bedtime ritual.

texts.name: Household Inventory
texts.notes: Located in storage room. Methodical script with check marks - appears to be possession tracking.

texts.name: Water Collection
texts.notes: Found near home well. Practical script with water level marks along the sides.

texts.name: Garden Notes
texts.notes: Discovered buried in garden plot. Weather-worn script with soil stains - outdoor use evident.

texts.name: Family Communication
texts.notes: Found in main living area. Affectionate script with careful lettering - possibly love note or family message.
